articleContent.title: Arpeggio: Minor 6th in E (Shape: G)
articleContent.content:
# Arpeggio: Minor 6th in E (Shape: G)

## Brief Presentation
An arpeggio is a musical technique where notes in a chord are played one after the other instead of simultaneously. In this case, the arpeggio is a Minor 6th in the key of E, using the G shape.

## Notes and Intervals
The notes in this arpeggio are E (root), G (minor third), B (perfect fifth), and C (minor sixth). The intervals between these notes are a minor third, another minor third, and finally a major second.

## Genre and Flavor
This arpeggio, with its minor tonality and the addition of the minor 6th interval, can evoke a sense of melancholy or mystery in music. It is commonly used in genres like jazz, blues, and rock to create emotive and introspective musical passages.

## Songs
Here are three songs that utilize the Minor 6th arpeggio in E (G shape):
1. "Stairway to Heaven" by Led Zeppelin (guitar solo)
2. "Don't Stop Believin'" by Journey (keyboard progression)
3. "Georgia on My Mind" by Ray Charles (piano accompaniment)
